name: Hyper Haiku
description:
Quick and punishing racing game. Collect the words on the track to form a haiku, if you mess up you start over, first player to cross the finish line with a full haiku collected wins.

Acceptable haikus consist of three lines of five, seven and five syllables.

Features awesome music and all words and final poem read aloud by our hyper haiku narrator.

Controls
Player one: W+S to boost and brake, A+D change lanes
Player two: I+K to boost and brake, J+L change lanes

Boost while hitting your opponent from behind and you'll bump them to another lane.

Post Jam Version: Minor polish, fixed some sound/music issues and added some sound effects that didn't make it into the jam version.

Made at Nordic Game Jam 2016 by:
Daniel Lewis, David Sandberg, Jacob Jenner Rasmussen, Jonathan Trier Brikner, Kristian Torgard, Maya Zachariassen
